excerpt: Clock tower, reconstructed in 1405, with mechanical moving figures on the hour & astronomical clock.
detail_description: In the heart of Bern's Old Town, the Zytglogge, or Clock Tower, is a historic landmark dating back to 1405. This 12-meter-high tower features mechanical moving figures that come to life on the hour, including a parade of bears, a jester, a golden rooster, and Chronos, the god of time.
name: Zytglogge

excerpt: Art museum with 2 exhibition halls showing paintings, drawings & watercolours by Paul Klee.
detail_description: Zentrum Paul Klee, located in Bern, Switzerland, is a unique art museum dedicated to the renowned Swiss artist Paul Klee. Opened in 2005, it houses the world's most important collection of Klee's works, showcasing around 4000 pieces, which make up 40% of his oeuvre. The museum features two exhibition halls displaying paintings, drawings, and watercolors by the artist.
name: Zentrum Paul Klee

excerpt: Gothic cathedral topped with 100m-high spire, known for its 1400s stained glass & sculptured portal.
detail_description: The Cathedral of Bern, a stunning example of late Gothic architecture, is an absolute must-see when exploring the Old Town. Standing tall at 100 meters, it proudly holds the title of Switzerland's tallest cathedral. Its impressive bell tower features a massive bell that weighs around 10 tons and has a diameter of about 2.5 meters. While the interior may appear understated, visitors are captivated by its exquisite stained glass windows and antique furnishings that tell stories from centuries past.
name: Cathedral of Bern

excerpt: Scenic views of Bern are offered from this mountain with an observation tower, hotel & restaurants.
detail_description: Gurten is a mountain in Bern that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding areas. Visitors can reach the top using the red Gurtenbahn funicular or by hiking or biking. At the summit, there's a 23-meter observation tower providing a 360-degree view of Schliern, Koniz, and Bern, as well as the Swiss Mittelland region and the Jura mountains.
name: Gurten

excerpt: Second-floor flat rented by Albert Einstein in the 1900s with period furniture, books & photographs.
detail_description: Einstein House, located in Bern, is a second-floor flat where Albert Einstein lived with his spouse from 1903 to 1905. The apartment has been transformed into a museum and showcases period furniture, books, and photographs that offer visitors a glimpse into the life of the famous scientist. Nearby, the Einstein Museum provides detailed information about Einstein's theories and life for science enthusiasts. Additionally, visitors can explore the Bern Historical Museum to learn more about Einstein's legacy.
name: Einstein House

detail_description: When in Bern, a visit to the Rose Garden, also known as Rosengarten, is a must. Situated on high ground near BarenPark, it offers a stunning panoramic view of Bern's Old Town and the Aare River. Once a cemetery, this garden was transformed in 1917 with the planting of its first roses. While the garden itself may be average, the breathtaking cityscape it overlooks is truly exceptional.
name: Rosengarten

excerpt: Museum opened in 1879 housing works by Paul Klee, Ferdinand Hodler, Meret Oppenheim & Pablo Picasso.
detail_description: Kunstmuseum Bern, established in 1879, is the oldest art museum in Switzerland. It boasts a vast collection of over 50,000 exhibits spanning eight centuries, including paintings and sculptures by renowned artists such as Paul Klee, Ferdinand Hodler, Meret Oppenheim, and Pablo Picasso. The museum features works from various art movements like impressionism, cubism, and surrealism.
name: Kunstmuseum Bern

detail_description: Bern Old Town View Point offers a captivating glimpse of the UNESCO-protected medieval Old Town, featuring cobblestone streets, clock towers, gothic cathedrals, covered shopping arcades, and charming red rooftops. The viewpoint provides an enchanting perspective of the city's beauty and historical significance. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk through the ancient streets or take a tram back if needed. Even in less-than-perfect weather, the old town remains beautiful and worth exploring.
name: Bern Old Town Viewpoint

excerpt: Museum on Swiss cultural history with archaeological & ethnographical objects from the Stone Age on.
detail_description: The Bernisches Historisches Museum, also known as the Einstein Museum, is a historical treasure trove located in Bern, Switzerland. This museum was designed by architect Andre Lambert and is the second-largest historical museum in the country.
name: Bernisches Historisches Museum / Einstein Museum

excerpt: Museum on people & their means of communication, with interactive exhibits & fictional characters.
detail_description: The Museum of Communication in Bern underwent a major renovation and expansion, reopening in August 2017. With nearly 2000 square meters of exhibition space, the museum features interactive stations that delve into human communication and the impact of technology on our interactions. Visitors can expect hands-on exhibits alongside a collection of vintage phones and computers. From ancient forms of communication to modern-day technology, this museum offers an engaging journey through the evolution of human interaction.
name: Museum of Communication

excerpt: UNESCO World Heritage Site with arcaded walkways, fountains & Switzerland's tallest cathedral.
detail_description: Bern Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a charming medieval center with arcaded walkways and cellar shops. The town boasts Switzerland's tallest cathedral and is surrounded by turquoise waters. Visitors can explore the cobbled streets, small wish fountains, and preserved statues while browsing through quaint bookstores and cafes. The town's clock tower, Zytglogge, is a focal point where tourists gather to watch its revolving figures twirl before the chimes begin.
name: UNESCO - Bern Old Town

excerpt: Hilly park incorporating a 19th-century bear pit, now home to many brown bears, the city's symbol.
detail_description: BearPark, located in Bern, is a hilly park that houses several brown bears, which are the city's symbol and have been since the 12th century. The park incorporates a 19th-century bear pit where the bears used to roam before being moved to their own spacious park in 2009. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the old town from the elevated Rose Garden above BearPark and from the platform of the cathedral tower.
name: BearPark

detail_description: Aussichtspunkt Bundeshaus, also known as the Federal Palace, stands as a prominent symbol of Bern's status as the capital city of Switzerland. This Neo Renaissance structure, built between 1894 and 1902, features a striking 64-meter high dome that is hard to miss. Visitors can enjoy stunning views from the nearby promenade, making it a must-see attraction in Bern.
name: Aussichtspunkt Bundeshaus

excerpt: Built in 1644 on the site of an earlier tower, this 49-m. baroque tower features a clock & a bell.
detail_description: Located in Bern, the Käfigturm is a 49-meter baroque tower with a clock and bell. It has a rich history dating back to the 13th century and has primarily functioned as a prison. The area around Käfigturm is bustling with activity, including a daily market at Bärenplatz where visitors can enjoy colorful flowers and fresh fruits. The tower is part of UNESCO heritage in Bern and offers an hourly display that adds to its charm.
name: Käfigturm

excerpt: Bern, the capital city of Switzerland, is built around a crook in the Aare River. It traces its origins back to the 12th century, with medieval architecture preserved in the Altstadt (Old Town). The Swiss Parliament and diplomats meet in the Neo-Renaissance Bundeshaus (Federal Palace). The Französische Kirche (French Church) and the nearby medieval tower known as the Zytglogge both date to the 13th century.
detail_description: Bern, the capital city of Switzerland, is situated around a bend in the Aare River and has a rich history dating back to the 12th century. The Altstadt (Old Town) boasts well-preserved medieval architecture, while the Neo-Renaissance Bundeshaus (Federal Palace) serves as the meeting place for Swiss Parliament and diplomats. Visitors can explore historic sites such as the Französische Kirche (French Church) and Zytglogge, a medieval tower.
name: Bern

excerpt: A Swiss heritage site, this arched freestone vehicle/pedestrian bridge offers city & river views.
detail_description: Nydegg Bridge, also known as Nydeggbrucke, is a significant historical landmark in Bern, Switzerland. This arched freestone bridge was completed in 1844 to accommodate the increasing traffic and tourism to the city. It connects the old town with the newer parts of Bern, offering stunning views of both the city and the Aare River.
name: Nydeggbrücke

detail_description: The bus stop 'Bärenpark' is located in the bear park, next to the Aare river. It offers a glimpse on the life of bears and their roams in 6,000 square meters of woods and bushes close to the river.
name: Bärenpark

excerpt: Bicameral, cupola-topped parliamentary assembly building with a viewing gallery & guided tours.
detail_description: The Parliament Building, also known as Bundeshaus, is the central hub of Swiss democracy and home to the Swiss Federal Assembly and Federal Council. Built in 1902, this bicameral assembly building features a cupola-topped dome and offers guided tours for visitors. The tours provide an up-close look at Swiss politics, taking you through the domed hall, council chambers, and famous foyer while providing interesting insights into the parliament's history.
name: The Parliament Building

excerpt: Opened in 1937, this animal park on 15 hectares offers a petting zoo, a vivarium & a bear park.
detail_description: Dählhölzli, established in 1937, is a 15-hectare animal park featuring a petting zoo, vivarium, and bear park. The walk to the zoo begins at BearPark and takes you through the historic Matte district to Marzili pool and Schonausteg before reaching Dählhölzli Zoo. Here, visitors can enjoy refreshments at the restaurant while observing over 220 animal species including ibex and wild boars.
name: Dählhölzli

detail_description: Bundesplatz, also known as the Federal Square, is a vibrant hub located in front of the Swiss Parliament Building in Bern, Switzerland. This large square was transformed from a parking lot into a bustling plaza that hosts weekly markets, cultural events, political rallies, and even features an ice-skating rink in winter. The square is adorned with an attractive water display consisting of 26 jets representing each canton of Switzerland.
name: Bundesplatz

excerpt: Hans Gieng's 16th-century fountain depicts a child-eating monster with a bag of children.
detail_description: In the heart of Bern's Old Town, Switzerland, stands the Kindlifresserbrunnen, a historic fountain dating back to 1545. This unique and somewhat eerie sculpture depicts a giant devouring a sack full of children, sparking intrigue and debate among historians and locals about its origins and meaning. Located in Kornhausplatz, this fountain is just one of many whimsical statue water fountains in Bern that visitors can explore while strolling through the medieval town.
name: Kindlifresserbrunnen

excerpt: Laid-back restaurant within a city park offering Mediterranean cuisine, plus wines & a terrace.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque city of Bern, Restaurant Rosengarten offers a delightful dining experience within a city park. With its Mediterranean cuisine and an extensive wine selection, this hidden gem provides a laid-back atmosphere and a terrace with stunning panoramic views. The restaurant is celebrated for its Swiss culinary delights and international dishes, catering to all palates including vegetarian options.
name: Restaurant Rosengarten

excerpt: Lush mountain park with an observation tower, hiking trails, a playground & other attractions.
detail_description: Gurten Park im Grünen is a renowned mountain park in Bern, offering a plethora of attractions for visitors. The park boasts an observation tower, hiking trails, and a playground, making it an ideal destination for families. With vast green spaces and lush trees, it provides a serene setting to unwind and enjoy nature. Accessible via the Gurten-Bahnli funicular railway, the park offers stunning panoramic views of Bern and the Bernese Alps.
name: Gurten Park im Grünen

excerpt: Botanical garden established in 1860 featuring thousands of plant species in greenhouses & outdoors.
detail_description: Universität Bern Botanical Garden, established in 1860, is a green oasis just a short walk from the main train station. It is home to around 5,500 native and exotic plants, offering a peaceful retreat for nature enthusiasts and anyone seeking tranquility in the city. Divided into four sections - alpine, Mediterranean, subtropical, and Arboretum - the garden showcases an impressive collection of plants from around the world.
name: Universität Bern Botanical Garden

detail_description: Kramgasse is a charming street in Bern, known for its picturesque wooden doors leading to historic cellars once used to store the city's abundant wine supply. The street is adorned with statues, fountains, and beautiful flowers, creating a serene atmosphere. It's a popular spot for photography and leisurely strolls. With its shops and cafes, some located in basements, Kramgasse offers an authentic Bernese experience.
name: Kramgasse

detail_description: Münsterplattform is a popular park in Bern, known for its elegant terrace next to the impressive Munster Cathedral. The cathedral's tower offers stunning panoramic views of the city, Swiss Midlands, and Bernese Oberland. It's a favorite spot for locals to gather with friends, play petanque, or enjoy coffee from the park's cafe.
name: Münsterplattform

excerpt: Museum with 1920s life-sized dioramas of animal habitats, plus geology exhibition & café.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bern, the Naturhistorisches Museum Bern is a treasure trove for nature enthusiasts and history buffs alike. This captivating museum showcases life-sized dioramas from the 1920s that vividly depict various animal habitats, alongside fascinating geology exhibitions. One of its most notable attractions is Barry, a legendary St. Bernard known for his heroic rescues in the Alps. The museum boasts an impressive collection of around 6.
name: Naturhistorisches Museum Bern

excerpt: Early 18th-century church built in the Baroque style & lined with sandstone pillars.
detail_description: Church of the Holy Spirit is an impressive 18th-century Baroque-style church adorned with sandstone pillars. Located on the commercial side of the city, it stands across from the Main Train Station and is hard to miss. The interior boasts unique lighting and a surprisingly low ceiling, making it a worthwhile visit for its architectural and historical significance. While not as ornate as Berner Munster, it remains one of the most beautiful churches from the late Baroque period.
name: Church of the Holy Spirit

excerpt: Meeting spot for local politicians to discuss matters & vote, with a viewing gallery for the public.
detail_description: Bern City Hall, located in the heart of the Old Town, serves as a meeting place for local politicians to discuss and vote on matters. The building dates back to the early 15th century and is the seat of the cantonal government. Visitors can observe parliamentary sessions from a viewing gallery while taking in the remarkable Gothic architecture. Although it was closed during some visits, its historical significance and inclusion on UNESCO's list make it an essential stop for tourists exploring Bern.
name: Bern City Hall

excerpt: Art collection with events including public tours, art lunches & 'art sitting' for elderly visitors.
detail_description: Kunsthalle Bern is a unique art space located in the picturesque city of Bern. It offers an eclectic mix of avant-garde installations, paintings, and sculptures that challenge traditional perceptions of art. The venue hosts public tours, art lunches, and 'art sitting' for elderly visitors. Additionally, it is situated in close proximity to the Einsteinhaus museum, which was once the home of Albert Einstein and his spouse Mileva from 1903 to 1905.
name: Kunsthalle Bern - Contemporary Art

excerpt: Park overlooking Bern's old town, with cherry trees, rhododendrons, irises & hundreds of roses.
detail_description: When visiting the charming country of Switzerland, be sure to include a visit to Rosengarten Bern in your itinerary. This park offers a stunning view of Bern's old town and features an array of beautiful flora including cherry trees, rhododendrons, irises, and hundreds of roses. While the gardens are lovely, the main draw is the spectacular panoramic view of the city. A leisurely stroll along the viewpoint allows visitors to take in breathtaking vistas both day and night.
name: Rose Garden Bern

excerpt: Small hilltop park with a lawn area, monuments & a music pavilion, plus scenic city views.
detail_description: Kleine Schanze in Bern is a charming hilltop park that offers scenic city views and a variety of attractions for visitors. This popular tourist spot features vast green areas, lush trees, and serene water ponds, providing an ideal setting for leisurely strolls and family outings.
name: Kleine Schanze

excerpt: Impressive vaulted space with a relaxed vibe, serving Mediterranean, Swiss & Bernese specialties.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bern, Kornhauskeller Restaurant & Bar is a stunning vaulted space that offers a relaxed atmosphere and serves an array of Mediterranean, Swiss, and Bernese specialties. This renowned establishment boasts an impressive interior with a central nave and two side aisles reminiscent of church architecture, exuding a sense of grandeur.
name: Kornhauskeller Restaurant & Bar

excerpt: Street with cobblestones in the medieval center, lined with colorful buildings & shops.
detail_description: Marktgasse is a charming cobblestone street nestled in the heart of Bern's medieval center, where vibrant buildings and eclectic shops create an inviting atmosphere. As you stroll along this historic thoroughfare, which seamlessly transitions into Kramgasse and Gerechtigkeitsgasse, you'll encounter delightful sights like the Kindlifresserbrunnen—a whimsical fountain featuring a giant snacking on children—located at Kornhausplatz.
name: Marktgasse

excerpt: This busy, city hub for swimming has several pools, grass lawns & a backdrop of historic buildings.
detail_description: Freibad Marzili, located on the banks of the Aare River in Bern, Switzerland, is a beloved outdoor swimming destination for both locals and tourists. This historic and spacious pool complex offers several pools, grass lawns, and stunning views of the river and nearby mountains. Visitors can deposit valuables in lockers before taking a refreshing dip or lounging on the grassy areas.
name: Freibad Marzili

excerpt: First built in 1346, this church with bronze reliefs at its entrance has undergone many changes.
detail_description: Nydeggkirche, also known as Nydegg Church, is a stunning Gothic church located in the eastern part of Bern's old city. Originally built in 1346, it has undergone numerous changes over the centuries. The church features bronze reliefs at its entrance and boasts a rich history, having been used as a warehouse during the Protestant Reformation before being restored to its original purpose. Visitors are welcome to attend services or simply admire the Gothic architecture inside.
name: Nydeggkirche

detail_description: Gerechtigkeitsgasse in Bern is a vibrant area where Cafe Restaurant Treff is located, offering a blend of East and West cultures. Situated near Bear Park and the Zytglogge Old Clock Tower, this spot attracts people from all over the world, creating a diverse atmosphere with multilingual conversations. The restaurant is known among locals as a place to indulge in culinary delights while engaging in discussions about art, philosophy, and global affairs.
name: Gerechtigkeitsgasse

excerpt: Craft beers, burgers & casual meals, plus ice cream, in a relaxed riverside setting with a terrace.
detail_description: Altes Tramdepot Brauerei Restaurant is a one-of-a-kind dining experience situated near the famous BearPark in Bern. This restaurant and brewery combo offers a wide range of craft beers, including light, Marzen, and wheat varieties brewed on-site.
name: Altes Tramdepot Brauerei Restaurant

detail_description: Tucked away in the historic Oktogon, a stunning octagonal structure that dates back to the 19th century, Hammam & SPA Oktogon Bern is a true oasis of tranquility. This four-story retreat specializes in traditional Middle Eastern cleansing rituals designed to refresh both body and spirit. At its core lies a soothing relaxation bath beneath an impressive 13-meter-high dome, creating an enchanting atmosphere for guests.
name: Hammam & SPA Oktogon

excerpt: Upscale Swiss restaurant, located in a former custom house, with stylish decor & river views.
detail_description: Brasserie Bärengraben is an upscale Swiss restaurant situated in a former custom house, offering stylish decor and scenic river views. The restaurant's location holds historical significance as the Pyrenean brown bears have been the symbol of Bern since its founding. In 2009, a new BearPark (Bärengraben) was established to provide a more natural habitat for the bears, featuring woods, a swimming area, and caves for hibernating.
name: Brasserie Bärengraben

detail_description: If you're looking for a fantastic way to unwind and have fun in Bern, Bernaqua is the ultimate destination. This wellness and sports center offers an impressive array of facilities that cater to both relaxation and adventure. With its indoor and outdoor swimming pools, sauna, hammam, solarium, treatment rooms, fitness center, shops, and a delightful restaurant all housed within the stunning Bernaquapalast building, there's something for everyone. Families will find plenty of excitement here as well!
name: Bernaqua | Erlebnisbad | Fitness | Wellness

detail_description: Zoo-Shop is a small but charming shop located in Dahlholzli park, not far from the city center. It offers a variety of items, from ice cream to stuffed animals, and purchasing a stuffed animal also contributes to donations for the animals at Dalholzli. The area around the zoo is free and perfect for leisurely walks along the river. Visitors can also enjoy petting zoos with no entry fee.
name: Zoo-Shop

excerpt: Displays on the Swiss Alps & mountains around the world, with Alpine restaurant & guided excursions.
detail_description: Nestled in Helvetiaplatz 4 in Bern, the Alpine Museum of Switzerland is a captivating institution delving into the intricate connection between mountains and people, culture, and nature in the Swiss Alps. It offers an unconventional exhibition on mountains worldwide, covering diverse topics such as climate change, glaciers, avalanches, mountain farming, tourism, and traditions. The museum provides an interactive platform for discussions while emphasizing the impact of mountains on humanity globally.
name: Alpine Museum of Switzerland

detail_description: World Escape is a unique escape game facility located in an ancient underground shelter. This unconventional escape experience demands extensive physical activity, involving considerable walking and running to unravel mysteries and conquer challenges. It caters to individuals seeking a more athletic escape room encounter, combining puzzle-solving with a sporty twist. Known as Belle escape room #escapeworldvernayazpetitjeu, this center is highly praised for its excellent organization and guarantee of enjoyable entertainment for all participants.
name: I-docens - World Escape

excerpt: This 16th-century landmark honoring the city's founder depicts a standing bear with a shield & flag.
detail_description: Zähringerbrunnen, also known as Zähringer Fountain, is a 16th-century landmark located in the Old City of Bern, a UNESCO World Heritage site. This historic fountain pays homage to Berchtold von Zähringer, the founder of Bern. The fountain features a standing bear holding a shield and flag, symbolizing the bear that Zähringer shot which led to the naming of the city.
name: Zähringer fountain

detail_description: Kornhausbrücke, also known as Kornhaus Bridge, is a prominent landmark in Bern. This massive bridge spans the Aare river and offers splendid views of the city and its historic architecture. While some find it more majestic from a distance, walking across it provides breathtaking sights of the winding river and picturesque surroundings. The bridge accommodates pedestrians, cars, and transit, making it accessible to all visitors.
name: Kornhausbrücke

excerpt: Dating from 1544, this fountain features a statue depicting the biblical Samson killing a lion.
detail_description: Simsonbrunnen, dating back to 1544, is a vivid and beautiful fountain located in the heart of Bern. It depicts the biblical story of Samson killing a lion, showcasing the Roman-clad hero grasping a lion by its mouth as described in the Book of Judges. This spot is popular among visitors for selfies and is one of eleven colorful figure fountains in Bern.
name: Simsonbrunnen

excerpt: Above a small fountain, a statue depicts a marksman holding a banner & a bear aiming a firearm.
detail_description: The Schützenbrunnen, also known as the Marksman Fountain, is a historic fountain located in Bern. Created between 1527 and 1543 by sculptor Hans Gieng, it features a statue of a marksman holding a banner and a bear cub aiming a firearm. The fountain has undergone restoration and relocation over the years but remains an iconic sight in the city. Originally standing at the end of Marktgasse, it now sits in front of Zytglogge.
name: Schützenbrunnen

excerpt: 16th-century stone fountain with a brightly painted monument depicting a woman representing justice.
detail_description: Gerechtigkeitsbrunnen, also known as the Fountain of Justice, is a 16th-century stone fountain located in Bern, Switzerland. It stands in front of the Bundesplatz and was constructed by Niklaus von Flue in 1543. The brightly painted monument depicts a woman symbolizing justice along with statues representing strength and prudence. This iconic site is just one of many fountains that adorn Bern's city center, each with its own unique design.
name: Gerechtigkeitsbrunnen
